medical_history.history_of_present_illness: One week before admission, the patient had fever, headache, nausea, malaise, and anorexia. The night before admission, she experienced a sensation of heaviness in her chest, dyspnea, and sweating, which did not improve with sublingual nitroglycerin.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of exertional chest pain, mild aortic stenosis diagnosed 40 months prior, nonâ€“Q-wave myocardial infarction 11 months prior, percutaneous transluminal coronary angioplasty with stent placement, hypothyroidism, and transient cerebral ischemic attack managed by left carotid endarterectomy.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had diabetes mellitus and heart disease; father died at 67 years from myocardial infarction.
medical_history.social_history: Occasional alcohol consumption; previously smoked cigarettes.
